content:
Does anyone know why the $document operation (http://build.fhir.org/composition-operation-document.html) does not have an output parameter in the definition? Section 2.42.13.1 states that

The server ... either returns a full document bundle, or returns an error

And the following example (http://build.fhir.org/composition-operation-document.html#examples) shows a Bundle is returned
Sounds like an error. Can you submit a tracker item?
Do we know which servers (if any) have implemented it? I would think that someone would have run into the issue previously.
Firely Sever has implemented it according to the sentence quoted above.
Wrapping it in a Parameters resource is too ugly to be intuitive :)

https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-32016
Also created another ticket while looking at this issue: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-32015. The problem for this one is that in the http://build.fhir.org/operations.html#executing we state that operation returned bundles are either collection or searchset. This is not correct for $document.

You don't have to wrap it in Parameters - but the operation does have to declare an output parameter. Otherwise, the operation is saying it returns nothing (and there are some operations that will behave that way).
I suspect there's been no problem because most people write code off the descriptive language, not the formal operation definition.
